metadata.case_name: Firm Ghulam Hussain Haji Yakoob Sons v. State of Rajasthan

facts.text: Mohammad Sagir took contract for cutting forest of Haranj Amrapura from Thakur of Nibaj on 12th July 1946 for five years to prepare charcoal.
Contract transferred to appellant by Sagir on 13th September 1948.
Contract extended by two years, endorsement on 15th April 1950.
Appellant prepared charcoal and exported it out of State of Sirohi.
Assistant Commissioner, Customs and Excise, Sirohi viewed appellant liable for customs duty As. 8/- per maund on 27,003 mds. charcoal exported; report to Commissioner on 11th February 1954.
Dy. Commissioner, Customs Excise ordered appellant exported charcoal without duty payment after 30th November 1948 amounting to 48,650 maunds; demanded Rs. 24,325/- on 17th December 1954.
Appellant's appeal to Government rejected on 24th May 1956; appellant knew on 5th April 1957 when asked by Tehsildar to deposit duty with interest.
Customs authorities requisitioned Collector of Sirohi; Collector issued notice under Public Demand Recovery Act on 9th February 1956.
Appellant filed writ petition under Art. 226 in Rajasthan High Court challenging notice; dismissed with costs on 13th November 1958.
Sirohi Customs Act 1944, Section 14: customs duties levied on goods in Tariff at prescribed rates on import/export.
Charcoal included in import Tariff but not export under 1944 Act.
Council of State created in 1940 by Ruler; advisory on new taxation (Schedule I entry 7); Ruler passes final orders.
Regency Act sanctioned 14th August 1947 due to minor Ruler; Board of Regency (Raj Mata Saheba as one member) represents Ruler.
Order dated 31st May 1948 issued pursuant to State Council Resolution 15th May 1948, approved by Her Highness Shri Rajmata Saheba; imposed export duty As. 8/- per maund on charcoal.
Sirohi merged into Rajasthan effective 25th January 1950.
Rajasthan Ordinance No.16 of 1949 effective 4th August 1949; revised tariff including charcoal export duty As. 8/- per maund via notification 10th August 1949.
Rajasthan Laws Application to Sirohi Act No.III of 1953; Ordinance 16/1949 not included in Schedule.

legal_issues.text: Whether the order dated 31st May 1948 imposing customs duty on export of charcoal is valid, given State Council's advisory role and need for Board of Regency approval.
Whether Rajasthan Ordinance No.16 of 1949 applies to Sirohi to sustain the duty levy.

petitioner_arguments.text: Order levying customs duty As. 8/- on charcoal invalid and ultra vires; Customs authorities not competent to levy; Collector not competent to issue demand notice.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Sirohi Customs Act 1944; State Council lacked legislative power

respondent_arguments.text: Duty levied validly by State Council resolution approved by Her Highness Shri Rajmata Saheba; Collector justified in issuing notice.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Council competence under 1940 notification; Rajmata acted for Board

respondent_arguments.text: Duty sustainable under Rajasthan Ordinance No.16 of 1949 and notification No.211/SRD dated 10th August 1949.

court_reasoning.text: Sirohi Customs Act 1944 ss.14-15: Duty only on Tariff goods at prescribed rates; Darbar can alter rates but not add items; charcoal not in export Tariff.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No power to add charcoal to export Tariff

court_reasoning.text: State Council advisory only (1940 notification); new taxation needs Ruler's final order; during minority, Board of Regency collectively holds power.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Council resolution needs Board approval to be law

court_reasoning.text: Order 31 May 1948 issued by Council Secretary, mentions Rajmata approval but not as Board President or on Board's behalf; no evidence of Board consultation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Rajmata's solo approval insufficient; Board must act collectively

court_reasoning.text: Ordinance 16/1949 applied to Rajasthan pre-Sirohi merger (25 Jan 1950); not extended to Sirohi by 1953 Act.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Sirohi not part of Rajasthan until 1950; no retrospective application without legislation

holdings.text: Impugned order of 31 May 1948 invalid; no valid levy of customs duty on appellant's charcoal exports.
Rajasthan Ordinance No.16 of 1949 does not apply to Sirohi to sustain levy.

statutes_cited.name: Sirohi Customs Act 1944
statutes_cited.relevance: Charging section for duties on Tariff goods; power to alter rates but not add items

statutes_cited.name: Sirohi Regency Act 1947
statutes_cited.relevance: Board of Regency represents Ruler during minority; collective action required

statutes_cited.name: Rajasthan Ordinance No.16 of 1949
statutes_cited.relevance: Authorised revised tariff including charcoal; but not applicable to Sirohi

statutes_cited.name: Rajasthan Laws Application to Sirohi Act No.III of 1953
statutes_cited.relevance: Specified laws applied to Sirohi; Ordinance 16/1949 not included

statutes_cited.name: Extra-Provincial Jurisdiction Act 1947
statutes_cited.relevance: Central Government notification delegated jurisdiction to Rajasthan effective 25 Jan 1950

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; writ of prohibition issued declaring appellant not liable for customs duty; orders of Dy. Commissioner, Minister of Excise Taxation, and Collector's demand notice quashed.
outcome.relief_granted: Writ in favour of appellant quashing all impugned orders and notices
outcome.costs: Not specified (High Court costs upheld but appeal succeeds)

key_quotes.text: The power conferred on the Darbar by s 15 is to fix and alter tariff rates. No power has been conferred on the Darbar to add to the list of taxable commodities in the Tariff itself.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Clarifies limits of executive power under Customs Act

key_quotes.text: Unless the Board passed the resolution, it could not take effect as a law in the State of Sirohi.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Emphasizes collective Board of Regency requirement for legislation

key_quotes.text: When Sirohi became a part of Rajasthan, the laws applicable to Rajasthan prior to the merger of Sirohi could be made applicable to Sirohi only after an appropriate legislation had been passed in that behalf.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects automatic extension of pre-merger laws to Sirohi
